website_summaries.verdict: An all-around great brake fluid, Prestone is inexpensive, delivers a great braking performance, and works to shield your brakes from common issues that stem from every day usage.
pros: Lasts longer than the average brake fluid
Works with disk, drum, and ABS brake systems
cons: Double-check to ensure that the bottle is securely sealed as soon as it arrives

customer_reviews.title: Got for Honda Accord. Good packaging. No damage or leaks.
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my 2013 Honda Accord. Service manual tells you to specifically use Honda brake fluid (3x times more expensive) which is a croc. Everyone knows brake fluid is brake fluid. All manufacturers have to follow DOT rated requirements. Myself nor anyone I know has ever had any problems with Prestone. It's cheap and gets the job done. Good packaging. No damage or leaks.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great For DIY Auto Repair
customer_reviews.text: After who knows how many years of use since the last brake fluid change, our '96 Camry was in desperate need. Rather than spend the ridiculous amount of money at a dealership, we did it ourselves. It was relatively easy to do, someone with limited mechanical ability and some tools could probably do it with a YouTube tutorial. There was no real difference in the way that the brakes felt, but at least we know that we won't die now. The Camry required 2 bottles to flush the old fluid, but it would have been nice to have 3 on hand.
customer_reviews.author: DanielleTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Used with an open seal
customer_reviews.text: I don't know if the break fluid broke the seal or if it's a returned product but when I received this item it wasn't sealed. I'm pretty upset with this as break fluid should be used right away. Who knows how long this break fluid was exposed to air.
customer_reviews.author: JYM

customer_reviews.title: What's hot... what's Not
customer_reviews.text: I was a brake and front end mechanic for a number of years. I've always use DOT 3 fluid on most applications. I realize DOT 4 had a much higher boiling point, but I've never had a boil over problem or brake failure as a consequence. I feel if your fluid is getting that hot, you are either over working your brakes, they are insufficient or becoming defective. I have seen where fluid has spewed from a weep hole in the reservoir, which actually served as a braking system indication of a problem. I suppose you could just up it to DOT 4, or see what's cooking.
customer_reviews.author: William S

customer_reviews.title: Great product.
customer_reviews.text: I really like using this product. The reason that I gave it 4 stars instead of 5 is that the cap was off when i received the item and the cap was crushed inside of the box , it still had the foil seal on it but I have no way of resealing it when I use some of it. I just wanted to get a new cap but there is no info on Amazon to request a new cap except for returning the entire product and I need to use it now or else I would have returned it for a new one.
customer_reviews.author: cathy

customer_reviews.title: Great brake fluid and does what it should
customer_reviews.text: This is DOT 3 and for those of you that may be wondering ***all dot 3 brake fluid is synthetic*** so yes it works fine with what you have. I used mine in a newer truck and a classic car. Prestone is my favorite because it stays cleaner longer in my usage. I have used other brands that cause components to fail sooner so whatever these guys are making they are doing it right.
customer_reviews.author: Chris X

customer_reviews.title: Good stuff
customer_reviews.text: Great brake fluid. Brake fluid does expire. So if you can buy smaller containers so they stay sealed if you don't need it all. Don't mix Dot 3 and Dot 5 so double check you car's break fluid. As always wear gloves this is not good stuff to get on your skin.
customer_reviews.author: GR

customer_reviews.title: Good value for brake fluid
customer_reviews.text: Prestone DOT 3 brake fluid 32 Oz. is a good value for your money. It easily topped off the brake fluid in my 1996 Toyota Tacoma pickup truck, and solved the sensitive brake fluid level switch which had illuminated the brake warning light even though the levels were above "min" This is a common problem in Tacoma pickups.
customer_reviews.author: Karl Lindheimer

customer_reviews.title: Seal of the bottle is fragile and not to be trusted.
customer_reviews.text: If you order this, check the seal when you get it. Went through 2 bottles of this and returned both of them. There seems to be serious quality control issues with the seal. The seals on both of the bottles were fragile and basically nonexistent. Lightly touching the seal opened it. Was the fluid still ok to use? Maybe. Am I going to bet my life on it? Nah.
customer_reviews.author: ConsumerX

customer_reviews.title: It's brake fluid...
customer_reviews.text: Not much to say other than it's the same prestone Dot 3 fluid you already know. I am taking a star off because last time I ordered this product from amazon the plastic cap of one bottle was broken off however the foil seal still stayed attached so no harm no foul.
customer_reviews.author: Robert

customer_reviews.title: Great quality at a great price.
customer_reviews.text: Bought a couple of these as I wanted to flush my entire brake system and hydraulic clutch system in my Honda civic (which is supposed to be done every 5 years) and also my brothers civic too. One bottle did both cars with plenty to spare.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Martin

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Had no problems after changing my fluid. The pedal felt stiff and my brakes felt strong. Before you go drive anywhere, pump the brake pedal a little to make it stiff.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Good. The bottle was enough to bleed my brake ...
customer_reviews.text: Good. The bottle was enough to bleed my brake system completely of the old fluid. Everything is working perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Decent but pouring is a challenge
customer_reviews.text: Decent stuff but very difficult to pour without spilling. WARNING : EXTREMELY COEROSIVE TO CAR PAINT. Must use a funnel or risk spoiling your car paint.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Mandal

customer_reviews.title: Damaged when arrived
customer_reviews.text: The lid on product was cracked, chipped and broken so once opened and the seal broken the remainder of the product could not be stored. Thus it was only able to be used once.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product - one bottle should flush one vehicle's brake system
customer_reviews.text: Flushed the vehicles brakes (didn't realize you are supposed to do this every 2 years!). One 32 oz bottle seems to be the right amount to do one vehicle. I did 3 vehicles with 3 bottles and all of them used about 31-31.9 oz. each to flush the brake system completely.
customer_reviews.author: WJ Handy Dad

customer_reviews.title: Good for most econo cars.
customer_reviews.text: Most common brake fluid for passenger cars. if you have a racing car, and often stomp the pedal to the metal, or run a mobile home or RV, perhaps go with dot 5.1 fluid. Or if you just ride it sporty, DOT 4 might also work for you. But other than that, DOT 3.1 is more than enough to do the job for economy cars and commuters.
customer_reviews.author: H B

customer_reviews.title: Broken cap on bottle.
customer_reviews.text: As many posters have said, bottle arrived with broken cap. I will not be able to store any leftover without it getting contaminated by moisture. Broken pieces of cap were in the box which was undamaged
customer_reviews.author: Wobeil

customer_reviews.title: Works great and have clearer clean fluid in breaks
customer_reviews.text: After purchasing I noticed there were 32 once bottles available at the local W for a dollar more than buy the 2 12 ounces on here. Plus turns out supertech has dot fluid for less and would of worked just fine. Oh well my fault really for not shopping around but since I needed other stuff on here this put me over for free shipping.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Przepierski

customer_reviews.title: Dot 3 brake fluid
customer_reviews.text: Using this over OEM fluid as it cost less and is just as good if not better. This 32 oz bottle was just enough to flush all 4 brake lines. Flush your brake fluid every 2-3 years.

customer_reviews.title: Ita brake fluid...
customer_reviews.text: Uses to bleed the lines and put through a 2007 4runner no problems or issues to note everything works great..

customer_reviews.title: Good value with dot3 quality for 2012 odyssey
customer_reviews.text: Great value then Honda dealer's same dot3 quality for 2012 Odysseus. I did flush it all four sides as YouTube easily
customer_reviews.author: John Lee

customer_reviews.title: Prestone - a legend lives on...... 😄
customer_reviews.text: What else is there to say? Prestone is a quality name brand that doesn't need much advertising. It is the manufacturer's recommendation for my car, so of course it works!
customer_reviews.author: Optimus Prime Member ;)

customer_reviews.title: Name product, works fine
customer_reviews.text: This is a name product and works as expected. I used it to top off my master cylinder when I bled the brakes.

customer_reviews.title: I'm not dead, so it works well.
customer_reviews.text: It's brake fluid. I haven't died a fiery death so it's obviously doing the job right.

customer_reviews.title: Dot 3 brake fluid!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect brake fluid for my 4 runner! Purchased 2 bottles because I flushed the system. Buy it!

customer_reviews.title: It's DOT 3 break fluid. It comes sealed and ...
customer_reviews.text: It's DOT 3 break fluid. It comes sealed and works for the application that it is designed for. Will purchase again if the price is competitive.
customer_reviews.author: John C.

customer_reviews.title: It stops your car
customer_reviews.text: It's brake fluid. The price was good and it wasn't leaking when I got it.
customer_reviews.author: KIM H.

customer_reviews.title: Very reliable product.
customer_reviews.text: A brand in which I've had complete faith for 40+ years in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best deal out there
customer_reviews.text: This was cheaper than anyplace I looked! And of course it works!

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: DOT 3 is recommended for nearly all cars on the road today. Save your money and get a great product.

customer_reviews.title: Good product overall ! Can be tried.!!
customer_reviews.text: This is the first time I bought this and looks like it is good for my vehicle since after topping up the oil I can feel the difference while applying breaks. The breaks I feel are better during the rainy times.

customer_reviews.title: Do it
customer_reviews.text: Flushed an entire system for my 03 Wrangler. Brakes are working, highly responsive again.

customer_reviews.text: Did a brake flush and added in the Prestone DOT 3 fluid about a year ago and my brakes still work great.

customer_reviews.title: As described
customer_reviews.text: Perfect amount for a brake system flush. Arrived on time and I would recommend.

customer_reviews.title: Don't drink it.
customer_reviews.text: It's Brake Fluid. What can I say. My car was using more brake fluid then gas. I had the fill the master cylinder daily. Got all the brake lines replaced.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Couple dollars cheaper than walmart! Had to get a 2nd bottle to do my truck.

customer_reviews.title: Presone DOT3 fluid - nothing more, nothing less.
customer_reviews.text: It's Prestone brake fluid. What more do you need to know other than that it's a really good price for this size bottle. Go forth and stop better.

customer_reviews.title: Quality Product At Great Price
customer_reviews.text: Authentic Prestone synthetic brake fluid. Much better than the non-synthetics, and very reasonably priced here.

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: This is a good value. You go to O’Reilly, Advanced Auto Parts, etc. And they would not sell you a 32 oz DOT 3 that cheap. Plus it’s a good brand. Loved it

customer_reviews.text: Brake fluid goes out on my daily driver too often. Rather purchase these for same price than the AutoZone name brand.

customer_reviews.title: Recommended.
customer_reviews.text: Product performs as expected. No problems with the braking system since I replaced the master cylinder and used this brake fluid to bled and refill the reservoir. I would recommend this product. This is just a small bottle. Same price as Meijer.

customer_reviews.title: Synthetics are best
customer_reviews.text: I always use synthetics whenever I can, brake fluid, oil and especially auto trans fluid. Long lasting and better withstanding pressure and heat.

customer_reviews.title: 8l works great thank you
customer_reviews.text: Just what I need for my 1995 Buick regal custom 3.8l works great thank you!

customer_reviews.title: I'm not sure how I could love it, but it does what it's suppose to ...
customer_reviews.text: It's brake fluid.. I'm not sure how I could love it, but it does what it's suppose to do.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Good Stuff! The local auto parts had this product for 20.99.
customer_reviews.author: Get this now!

customer_reviews.title: Great fluid!
customer_reviews.text: It did exactly what I needed it to do. I flushed my Honda Element and Civic no problem. It's nice to have non-brown fluid again :)

customer_reviews.title: Brake fluid.Does its job.
customer_reviews.text: Will stop your car/truck/bike. Which makes it an awesome product. This came out cheaper then the local auto parts store.
customer_reviews.author: MaksV

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy
customer_reviews.text: Came as described, perfect condition and a full bottle. Not much to ask for!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Shipped fast, I got what I expected and it works well.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Like OEM Ford Fluid. Clear.
customer_reviews.text: The bottles have the metallic seal under the cap, that you have to pull off or cut out, so it is unlikely they will leak during shipping. The fluid is clear, just like OEM. Like a lot of people, when time comes to replace the fluid, I just remove what is in the reservoir and refill. I use a big syringe to remove the fluid. Repeat every oil change until you use up the entire 32 ounce bottle. By then, most of the fluid in there should be new.
customer_reviews.author: A. Clark

customer_reviews.title: Carefully Inspect Cellophane Seal Before Use
customer_reviews.text: Two bottles of this brake fluid was purchased primarily because of the add-on price. Once received, I noticed that the cellophane safety seal under the cap wasn't very secure and peeled away from each bottle very easily, which made me wonder about the age and possibly of moisture contamination. I decided not to use this fluid for bleeding my brskes. Brake fluid easily attacks mousture.
customer_reviews.author: Carlos

customer_reviews.title: Great No Frills Brake Fluid
customer_reviews.text: This is a no frills brake fluid I used in my 2008 Honda Civic. I have never did a brake fluid change until now. Let me tell you, the car runs pretty darn well! The clutch felt softer and more fluid. The old brake fluid was pitch black! The almost clear fluid helped with the fluid exchange since I was able to tell when the old fluid was flushed out. Recommended product.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Probably the safest.
customer_reviews.text: They say brake fluid is flammable and strips paint, but i found that to be false with thos brand, i rubbed it on my fender to test and it just smeared the dirt. And for the flammable i was trying to blow torch the bleeder bolt off and i had it spray when i disconnected the caliper, didnt light up or anything. (Bleeder is still stuck btw)
customer_reviews.author: Derek Rodgers

customer_reviews.title: fluid looks good but the seals on the 4 jugs i bought ...
customer_reviews.text: fluid looks good but the seals on the 4 jugs i bought were so old they broke down and were failing when i took the lid off. i clearly got old stock but the product still served its purpose well
customer_reviews.author: Bkovey

customer_reviews.title: Lekaed
customer_reviews.text: Ordered 2 of these and they both were unsealed. This brake fluid is great but don't buy online just go in store to buy it.

customer_reviews.text: Cheaper here than anywhere else and 32oz is more than enough to completely drain and refill any non-racecar.

customer_reviews.text: Top off my reservoir and I did not die in a fiery crash, so I guess the stuff works as advertised.

customer_reviews.text: The seal was broken. Very disappointed being that brake fluid absorbs water at a faster rate after the seal is broken.

customer_reviews.title: Broken Seal
customer_reviews.text: The seal was previously open. It was put back to look sealed but it wasn't. Very disappointed. I still use it for my Matrix 2006 and hoping it wasn't contaminated oil. I've tested the brakes and so far so good for almost 2 weeks now.

customer_reviews.title: Great Brake Fluid
customer_reviews.text: Flushed the brakes in my 2008 Yaris and this fluid worked well. Cheaper than regular price in the autoparts store as well. Make sure you use a new bottle when you are changing/adding brake fluid to prevent excess water being added to your brake system. And make sure to get the right fluid for your car (mine took DOT 3, yours may say otherwise).

product_meta.title: Prestone AS401 DOT 3 Synthetic Brake Fluid - 32 oz.
product_meta.description: Size:32 OuncePrestone Synthetic Hi-Temp Brake Fluid is designed to provide an extra margin of boiling point protection. The mix of polyglycol ethers ensures hot brake-system operation will not create dangerous vapor. This delivers braking power when needed by avoiding a spongy pedal. Both wet and dry boiling points exceed the minimum government standards. A comprehensive inhibitor package protects vital brake system metals. Prestone brand Synthetic Brake Fluid is designed for safe operation of today’s modern brake systems. Excellent for ABS, disc and drum brake systems. Minimum dry boiling point: 460 degrees Fahrenheit (238 degrees Celsius). Minimum wet boiling point: 284 degrees Fahrenheit (140 degrees Celsius). Complies with Federal Motor Vehicle Safety Standard 116. Meets SAE J1703.
feature_bullets: Provides an extra margin of safety in extreme braking conditions
Mix of polyglycol ethers ensures hot brake-system operation will not create dangerous vapor
Excellent for ABS, disc and drum brake systems
Delivers braking power when needed by avoiding a spongy pedal
Both wet and dry boiling points exceed the minimum government standards

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.7 out of 5 stars413 ratings4.7 out of 5 stars
